page.title: 15PADBURY & HILLESDEN PATHWAYS
page.content: Within our area are many public foot- paths and bridleways. Some are well used others almost lost. Some are very old, indeed the origin of the name Padbury is said to be from 'pad' or 'pack', a narrow path used by pack horses, and 'bury' meaning a mound or burgh. One pathway, now made difficult to use, follows the 'back lane' of the Anglo Saxon centre of the village. Other footpaths link with nearby settlements more directly than do modern roads. This applies especially to paths between Padbury and Hillesden about three and a half miles apart by footpath and five and a half by road. Sometimes paths converge at obvious places like a river crossing or farm but sometimes as many as 5 or 6 paths meet at what is now just a corner of a field.
